definition: to send off to accomplish a duty
sentence: The carpenter dispatched  his assistant to fetch wood.

definition: a state of being held in low regard
sentence: The ofﬁcer fell into disrepute  after it was learned that he had disobeyed the orders he had given to his own soldiers.

definition: to persuade someone not to do something
sentence: Worried that he would catch a cold, she tried to dissuade  him from going out on winter nights.

definition: consisting of a diverse variety of elements

definition: to wipe out, obliterate, rub away

definition: a speech given in honor of a dead person

definition: to bring forth, draw out, evoke

definition: to steal money by falsifying records
sentence: The accountant was ﬁred for embezzling  $10,000 of the company’s funds.

definition: to correct or revise a written text
sentence: If my sentence is incorrect, the editor will emend  what I have written.

definition: sensitivity to another’s feelings as if they were one’s own

definition: to ﬁll with love, fascinate, usually used in passive form followed by “of” or “with”
sentence: I grew enamored  of that boy when he quoted my favorite love poem.

definition: the audience’s demand for a repeat performance; also the artist’s performance in response to that demand

definition: relating to or contained in letters

definition: to take up as a cause, support

definition: the history of words, their origin and development
sentence: From the study of etymology, I know that the word “quixotic” derives from Don Quixote and the word “gaudy” refers to the Spanish architect Gaudí.

definition: to free from guilt or blame, exonerate

definition: meticulous, demanding, having high and often unattainable standards

definition: happening by chance, often lucky or fortunate

definition: a medium for lecture or discussion

definition: injurious, hurtful; serious or grave in nature
